newsitem.title: USA: Indiana regulators set phone interconnection terms.
newsitem.headline: Indiana regulators set phone interconnection terms.

text.p: AT&T Corp said Tuesday the Indiana Utility Regulatory Commission set prices, terms and conditions for the long distance carrier's interconnection with Ameritech Corp's local network.

The regulatory panel ordered a 21 percent across-the-board wholesale discount on the resale of Ameritech's local tepehone service, AT&T said. Both companies are expected to file a formal joint business agreement by December 28.
The decision is a step toward giving Indiana residents a choice for local telephone service, AT&T said.
